transcript.text: chapter 11 the journey part 1 11 p.m.
saturday night a restaurant I heard the
clink of civil whereas I excitedly
spread the Atlas on the table before me
my wife adventure filling her eyes
scooted next to me in the booth I traced
my finger from Oregon south and the
California toward the Sierra Nevadas
will head to the crabs first there's a
university I can preach at in Fresno
just south of where they live Monica
nodded as the waitress said our food
before us our two boys were sleeping
soundly in the double stroller parked in
front of the table i can drive once you
get tired my wife said if we're planning
to drive off of the night that was the
idea we had spent a restful sabbath of
our messianic congregation the pastor
had laid hands on us prayed and sent us
with his blessing our van packed with
most of our essential belongings and the
rest stored on my wife's parents house
we were ready hit the
The Oregonian had given me a generous
severance pay of over four thousand
dollars mark from PS you had agreed to
print out to distribute a monthly
newsletter for us while we were on the
road we hope to generate enough support
by the time we ran out of our money at
just past 2am crossing the moon dappled
mountains mountainous border from Oregon
into California I felt myself nodding
off my hands slipping at the wheel
Daniel Annika was sitting in the very
back of the band the boys go ahead and
pull how did you know I was drifting off
I asked my wife while I climbed
with the boys yah spoke to told me to
tell you to pull over she said simply I
was so grateful that Yahshua was already
protecting us on our journey flash
forward bright morning California Sun
stream to the diner in Sacramento we
were planning to stay with some friends
of ours who had attended our messianic
congregation in Portland Oregon but had
moved down to California in search of
work and to be near family as annika
helped our two little ones eat I called
our friends we're about three hours from
you guys and said prabha crabs voice
sounded ominous over phone it has begun
what's begun the president just
announced her invading Iraq are you
serious just in time for Purim Robert
said so the nation was going to war
right when we were headed out to the
spiritual warfare college campuses
across the USA it felt so prophetic we
spent the next week preaching at CSU and
Fresno while staying with our friends in
the beautiful Sierra Nevada mountains as
the week drew to a close my wife and I
realized we had no idea where we were
going to stay for the rest of our road
trip four thousand dollars we get sucked
up real fast in hotels and restaurants I
have something for you Roberts wife
Alexis said on our last morning in their
home she placed a purple book in my
hands called Mennonites your way it's a
directory of Mennonites all across the
country that make it a ministry to take
people in who are on the road doing
evangelism oh wow I said taking the book
and flipping through the pages how did
you find something like this Alexis
explained how she had been raised in a
Mennonite Church before becoming a
messianic is usually several families in
almost every major city some and smaller
towns as well once again Yahshua was
leading us step by step on this
missionary journey providing as we
placed our faith in him
I remember well packing our van that
bright morning the tall California pines
glistened in the sunlight the cool
mountain air breathed with crisp
freshness the birds sang and hope was in
the air Robert and his wife stood on
their porch waving us goodbye and
praying their blessings upon us as we
headed south I wanted to go to UCLA next
but their spring break had just begun so
we headed first to Phoenix Arizona where
we would preach at ASU the scorching
heat and endless blue skies of Arizona
were a shock to our Oregonian systems we
couldn't believe spring could be so hot
as we drove around the sun-baked city
annika started calling various
Mennonites in the area one was a
disconnected phone number another family
moved away another family was no longer
hosting sitting in a parking lot at a
gas station in tempe i began to wonder
if we'd had if we'd have to use our
money and stay in a hotel after all
doing the calculations in my head i
realize the whole week in hotels here
which severely eat into our cash wait
there's one last family i noticed i
decided to make the call and an older
woman answer the phone oh yes we are
retired and don't have much space but
you're welcome to stay here oh thank you
the Mennonites were in their 70s and led
us to a room where the boys could sleep
in some small pullout cots and we had a
bed to ourselves so what exactly are you
doing in Phoenix
man asked I began explaining how we were
messy annex preaching a return to Torah
through a love for the Messiah but the
older couple looked at us with blank
stares diplomatically I cut short an
explanation said we're just trying to
reach the students at ASU well they need
it their mascot is a su Devils the old
man laughed the first day today is he
was a huge flop I stood out in a field
preaching of the Sun was so hot and
there was so little shade I could barely
draw any sort of crowd the campus was
far larger than either psu or CSU so I
knew I just had to find a better
location second day yah showed up I
planted myself near a large fountain
surrounded by trees the cool purple
shadows and the nearby water were
perfectly draw crowd within minutes
around 200 students have gathered as I
exalted the Torah and preached Yasha
by the end of the week chapped lips and
son Burt we had preached a thousands of
students one young man and his
girlfriend approached me for the end of
our last day preaching never heard this
stuff before can we take you guys out to
dinner that evening as we ate with these
two ASU students they peppered my wife
and I with questions about the Hebrew
roots of the Christian faith this is
just so amazing other street preachers
have come through here but they usually
just call people names or cut people
down they rarely use scripture but
Daniel what you were preaching was just
amazing tears filled my eyes while we
spent several hours answering all their
questions giving them as much truth as
they could handle thank you both so much
for coming to our campus they said as we
walk back to our car our cell phone
ringing and I could see on ACCA's face
crumpling with dismay okay I'll let
Daniel know what is it she terminated
the phone call inside now the Mennonites
want us out of their house I guess we've
stayed too long exhausted from preaching
and Sabbath approaching I wondered what
we were going to do wait a minute annika
suddenly remembered there was this lady
on campus who really liked the preaching
she gave me her number I'm going to give
her a call that lady turned out to be a
Pentecostal woman married with several
children we don't have much space but
you guys are welcome to come here in
fact i'd love to learn what this Shabbat
thing is all about surrounded by a sea
of toys in their small living room
Annika pulled out her guitar I pulled
out my Bible and we celebrated the
Sabbath with this humble Pentecostal
family we found out to our delight that
a Messianic Jew had recently visited
their church so they were very hungry to
learn more about the Hebrew roots of
their faith recharged we left early
Sunday morning heading west toward Los
Angeles West Hollywood and UCLA
our first call the Mennonite directory
landed us in a massive mansion of a
house in upland california this was a
younger couple self-employed business
owners who instantly took a liking to us
my wife has relieved that we have found
friendlier many nights than the ones in
Arizona you just make yourself at home
the wife said as she brought us into a
large double suite that looked like
something out of a lavish hotel cancun
we were overwhelmed by Yas goodness i
was particularly excited by the prospect
of preaching at UCLA several years
earlier while a junior in high school I
had attended a Hollywood media workshop
based at UCLA the very place where I
once wanted to pursue my own selfish
dreams of being a Hollywood screenwriter
now would be where I would assault
yahshua the next morning annika woke me
annual boys are not feeling to it would
you mind going to the campus alone
after praying for the voice and waving
goodbye to the family I braved the
freeways of Los Angeles toward UCLA I
was very nervous because I never
preached on a campus outside of Portland
alone before
but as I listened to a worship song on
our CD player called at the cross I knew
my message would be to exalt the blood
atonement of Yahshua little did I know
West Hollywood and UCLA was the third
highest population Purdue's next to
Brooklyn New York and Israel itself
driving along Wilshire Boulevard I
notice sandwich between the towering
glass skyscrapers Jewish synagogues on
almost every corner the campus itself
was as beautiful as I had remembered it
and when I visited here years ago in
high school sweeping lawns red brick
towers terraced gardens a mosaic tiled
library this is by far the largest and
wealthiest campus I'd ever reach them I
stood on bruin walk a major thoroughfare
for students that cuts right through the
heart of the campus wearing my Jewish
delete lifting my Bible in my hands I
began to preach on the blood atonement
of Yahshua within a half hour I cried a
crowd of 300 students surrounding me
surrounded me two young Jewish women in
flowing dresses flanked each side of my
crowd mocking into writing me you were
probably sent from the Baptist Church
one of the female sneered no I don't
think the Baptist would agree with my
preaching on turning away from all sin
and being filled with the gifts of the
Ruach I fired back as I noticed more and
more keep a clad Jews filling the crowd
an older man wearing a deep blue kippah
and flowing white fringes identified
himself as one of the head rabbis at
UCLA Daniel please for everyone here in
the crowd explained Isaiah 53 well it's
a prophecy about the Messiah Yahshua I
said the rabbi smiled is several the
Jews in the crowd laughed I knew you
would say this Daniel but if you read
Isaiah 53 closely you will discover this
passage is about the nation of Israel
not the Jewish Messiah I opened my Bible
and begin to read Isaiah 53 quietly
asking you ought to give me an answer
for this rabbi it's okay Daniel if you
don't have a response he mocked I
understand well can you explain one
thing to me then I asked lifting my eyes
from the Bible toward the rabbi the
crowd of 300 students hushed listening
to our debate now I don't know Hebrew
very well but my English version says
that the subject of Isaiah 53 whoever
this is talking about will have done no
violence neither will it be any deceit
in his mouth are you telling me that no
Jew in the nation of Israel has ever
lied or committed an act of violence the
rabbi visibly paled and a deeper hush
fell upon the crowd
he instantly retreated into the crowd
and walked quickly away I will tell you
who Isaiah 53 is about and from that
point on I began to magnify Yahshua even
more preaching on his blood atonement
many of the Jews listen for the rest of
the day and their mobberley ceased
exhausted from hours of preaching I
gathered my belongings and notice my
tallit was gone ah probably someone had
stolen frustrated I felt someone grab my
arm a young student whose eyes why
begged for me to talk with him Daniel
I've never heard this kind of stuff that
you're preaching are you coming back
tomorrow yes I will be here all week
would you like to go out to dinner
sometime in the next few days absolutely
for preaching and then a Christian for a
long time never even thought about the
Hebrew roots of faith I definitely want
to learn more
we talked as I made my way across campus
back toward my parked car he continued
to ask me questions and i continued to
answer him with every step we took his
excitement of the group I have to get to
an evening class but i'll be sure to
find you tomorrow the students said
shaking my hand
I walked along a city street toward the
parking lot and fumbled for my cell
phone as good as this day had been I
would need to tell Annika the bad news
that I had lost my delete the very to
lead I had received when Elijah was born
I pause in front of a shop dialing the
phone number when a familiar sight
caught my eye posted to the blast window
of a shock a glossy eight by call
photograph of a blue pouch Hebrew
letters faced a sign over the picture
said lost delete please claim hello
Annika picked up on the other end honey
you're not going to believe this I'll
call you back in just a second as I
walked into the shop I told the owner
that I had lost my tallit a few hours
ago while preaching at UCLA well here
you go he said with a friendly smile
someone dropped this off here said they
had found it along the street now what
were the chance is that in West
Hollywood out of the thousands of stores
surrounding UCLA that I would just
happen to find the very spot someone had
dropped off my missing tallit once again
Yasha was proving over and over again
that he was with us as we continue to
cross the Jordan into this amazing
promised land
you
